boardgame.name: Flucht aus Berlin
boardgame.description:
Trapped in the German capital.
In this thrilling escape adventure, all players have to work together to find an escape route from Berlin in good time during 8 different puzzles. The tricky puzzles lead you to the most popular sights of the metropolis - past the Brandenburg Gate, to the Museum Island and along the Berlin Wall. In a handy card format, this puzzle game transforms both a trip to Berlin and a cozy game evening into an exciting escape experience.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Gefangen in der deutschen Hauptstadt.
Bei diesem packenden Escape-Abenteuer müssen alle Spieler zusammenarbeiten, um rechtzeitig einen Fluchtweg aus Berlin zu finden. Die kniffligen Rätsel führen sie zu den beliebtesten Sehenswürdigkeiten der Metropole – am Brandenburger Tor vorbei, zur Museumsinsel und entlang der Berliner Mauer. In einem handlichen Kartenformat verwandelt dieses Rätselspiel sowohl eine Reise nach Berlin als auch einen gemütlichen Spieleabend in ein spannendes Escape-Erlebnis.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Décadex
boardgame.description:
The game board is a grid of colored numbers (1-4) with intersecting lines between the numbers. Players take turns placing 4 rings each on the board, and then moving those rings to achieve a total of 10. To win the game, the four rings must be placed on four numbers of four different colors or 2 pairs of identical colors.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Walls of Castle Direhold: The Complete Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Walls of Castle Direhold is a printable tile set compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Its Dynamic Modular Tile System combines the unique detail and individuality of a bespoke battle map with the re-usability and limitless combinations of a traditional modular map set. Its simple tile system is ideal for creating exciting and unique castle complexes, from vast fortresses to smaller buildings such as manor houses or temples.

User summary:

The tiles are distributed in multiple file formats.

boardgame.name: Curse of the Queen's Ransom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your party must brave the horrors of a long lost pirate ship, freshly back from the far side of hell.

This is a single session adventure for a party of four characters with an APL of 2. Players who survive should reach level 3.

boardgame.name: The Simple Game System Second Edition
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

You are reading The Simple Game System, a role-playing game of supreme simplicity, ease of play, and fast action.

boardgame.name: Early Middle Ages, Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A system-agnostic sourcebook in two volumes, for any historical or fantasy game.

Early Middle Ages presents a real-world account of Europe from the dawn of the 9th century through the 11th century. Based on the academic work of Henry Osborn Taylor, it focuses on the effect of Christianity on scholarship and culture, for better or worse, with both a sympathetic eye toward the people of the time, and a critical judgment that can only be gained in retrospect.

The result is a look at the period that goes beyond the lineages of kings and chronicles of various wars. This volume is filled with information that can be mined for worldbuilding details usable in your own settings. There are colorful characters that can be adapted as villains and non-player characters. Story hooks abound, either as background details for your game world, or as adventure seeds for player characters to pursue.

boardgame.name: Early Middle Ages, Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A system-agnostic sourcebook in two volumes, for any historical or fantasy game.

Early Middle Ages presents a real-world account of Europe from the dawn of the 9th century through the 11th century. Based on the academic work of Henry Osborn Taylor, it focuses on the effect of Christianity on scholarship and culture, for better or worse, with both a sympathetic eye toward the people of the time, and a critical judgment that can only be gained in retrospect.

The result is a look at the period that goes beyond the lineages of kings and chronicles of various wars. This volume is filled with information that can be mined for worldbuilding details usable in your own settings. There are colorful characters that can be adapted as villains and non-player characters. Story hooks abound, either as background details for your game world, or as adventure seeds for player characters to pursue.

boardgame.name: Journey Supplement: Expanded Aspects
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome back, traveler!

This supplement for the bestselling worldbuilding tool and solo roleplaying game Journey doubles the list of Aspects available to players in one handy document! In Journey, Aspects are the interesting and granular details that explorers will 'zoom in' on while exploring, adding a depth of detail and sense of life to the worlds they have created. This expansion offers a whole new source of inspiration to players, adding new and exciting possibilities to take back to their writing, campaign setting, or other worldbuilding work.

These Aspect lists can be mixed in with the originals to change things up a little, used in place of them altogether to change things up a lot, or players can pick and choose from both sets to get the best of both worlds.

boardgame.name: Builders Pack 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We’ve got some Modular Pipes for you! – in 4 sizes and 4 color variants! (Rough Metal, Rusty, Brass and Polished Metal)

Plus some other parts like Valves, Gauges, Pipe Holders and other addons.

We tried to make this pack as versatile as possible, hope you’ll like it!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1140!

boardgame.name: Tabloid Charades
boardgame.description:
Charades based on actual tabloid stories!

Tabloid Chardes is intended as a light-hearted diversion, not a game of heated competition. Teams work with, not against, one another. A member of TEAM 1 acts out a charade on his team card while TEAM 2 guesses, then a member of TEAM 2 acts while TEAM 1 guesses.

The charades in each round round do not have to be performed in any particular order. Each performer is free to act out the charade of his choice, and may seek the help of other team members if stuck.

The game has been designed to play in one evening.

VARIATIONS
1. Instead of the performer choosing the charade he will act out, have the other team pick a number.
2. Certain charades might be taken on as a group project, with team members acting together to achieve the desired effect.

boardgame.name: The Crystal Cleaver of Griezt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Crystal Cleaver is a one-shot heist that’s ready for BITD, 5e, or another system.

Assemble a team to steal the cursed weapon from its owner’s museum collection. We provide the background, locations, and complications. You provide the rest.

boardgame.name: Shift
boardgame.description:
The game board is a plastic six by six square grid which allows for the sliding of pieces. Players take turns placing their counters (20 each) on the board. Players are allowed to "shift" rows of counters to block their opponent's attempt to get 5 in a row.

The game is made in Hong Kong.

boardgame.name: Bread Rondo
boardgame.description:
"In a world where magic rules everything, you are the best baker in town.

But you've accidentally read a forbidden grimoire and are trapped in a dream world.

With the help of the friends in your heart, you can fight the curse of the grimoire!"

Bread Rondo is a bold and detailed redesign of Blade Rondo, by the designer Pawn, in collaboration with MAGI, the creators of the "Magical Bakery" series.

Bread Rondo is even harder than the original - you play with 5 cards instead of 7. With a lower life limit of 10, you're in for one hell of a fight!

However, as a baker, even in the midst of battle, you can't afford to neglect your baking and it's up to you to make sure your bread is delicious and to unleash its hidden powers. Proper temperature control and mindful baking are the keys to success, but don't let your enthusiasm for baking great bread knock you over before you've even opened the oven!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:

boardgame.name: TRAILS
boardgame.description:
Take a hike in TRAILS, exploring iconic sites and national parks across the U.S., gathering resources, observing wildlife, and earning wilderness badges. TRAILS is a standalone adventure in the PARKS series with artwork from the Fifty-Nine Parks Print Series.

In TRAILS, players hike back and forth along the trail, collecting rocks, acorns and leaves; taking pictures; and encountering wildlife to gain bonuses. At trailhead and trail end, you can turn in resources to earn badges, after which you start back in the other direction.

As players visit the trail end, the sun sets over the trail. As night falls, trail sites grant more powerful actions, but they won't last forever. When the sun leaves the trail, the last round of play takes place, then the player with the most points from collected badges, photos taken, and bird sightings wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kart Dungeon
boardgame.description:
In a Dark Castle a competition is fought, a group of crazy beings drive at high speed to find out who is the best arcane kart driver, using powerful artifacts and avoiding dangerous glyphs, only one will be the winner.

Kart Dungeon is a fantasy racing game where 2 to 4 players compete on a modular 3/4 cards (double sided) using medieval characters like a crusader, goblin, rogue, wizard, etc (a total of 8 characters, 4 double sided cards) driving on karts and picking up several power ups (artifacts) to take advantage and mess the other players run.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Travel Zombicide: 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Kill zombies anywhere.

Take Zombicide anywhere with you!

Travel Zombicide offers you the Zombicide: 2nd Edition experience in a smart, easily transportable package. With an innovative design, the game has a compact plastic case and components with special dimensions perfect for vacations, car trips, or to be easily transported to a friend's house. Easily carry all the game components and have Zombicide: 2nd Edition ready to play under any circumstances!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stories from the Outbreak, Mission Compendium
boardgame.description:
Every Survivor has a story to tell.

Stories from the Outbreak adds 10 complete missions to Zombicide: Chronicles, the roleplaying game set in the famous world of the Zombicide boardgame.

Each adventure takes place in a different City District and corresponds to one of the 10 Mission types presented in the Zombicide: Chronicles core book.

Meet new Non-Playing Survivors that may aid you or make your life surprisingly more difficult, depending on how you interact with them. Face several new enemies, from gigantic Abominations to dangerous human beings. And explore new, exciting sights around the Zombie town, from a Church with a dark secret, to an abandoned Aquarium, and much more.

You and your friends have a Mission to fulfill, but will you manage to overcome the Hordes and live to fight another day?

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Chronicles Field Guide
Zombicide: Chronicles Field Guide
boardgame.description:
There are 101 ways to die in the world of Zombicide, but 1001 ways to kill!

The Zombicide: Chronicles Field Guide adds new Survivor Archetypes, new Gear, NPS, Rumors, and a ton of new mechanics to the Zombicide: Chronicles RPG core book.

Famous features of the Zombicide board game are now a part of the Zombicide: Chronicles as well. Fight even after death as a Zombivor, meet new Companions that will certainly help you in your Missions, find new Vehicles around the City, and fight your way through crowds of Very Infected People.

Improve your story with a new Mission Generator and keep your friends safe with additional Shelter Rules. Travel Events will take you from one place to the next, and the Rumors you hear from time to time will give you reasons to keep on going.

The world might be ending, but your Survivor's adventure is just about to start.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Chronicles Gamemaster Starter Kit
boardgame.description:
Stress is good. Stress means you're still alive.

Being a Gamemaster is not always easy, but it's about to get a lot more exciting.

The Gamemaster Starter Kitcomes with an exclusive GM Screen with all the information a Gamemaster will need to lead Survivors through an amazing adventure in Zombicide: Chronicles, the RPG set in the world of the famous Zombicide board game. New Survivor ID Sheets will help players to quickly begin their story, and the new Adrenaline Dials will help you keep easy track of your Adrenaline during Missions.

Team Up and Gear Up, because a new adventure is about to begin.

boardgame.name: Nico: The Sandwich Guy ID Sheet
boardgame.description:
This is an exclusive ID Sheet for the character Nico: The Sandwich Guy released in the Zombicide: 2nd Edition and Zombicide: Chronicles RPG Kickstarter.

It adds a new archetype to the Zombicide: Chronicles RPG.

boardgame.name: Will You Lie with Me Tonight Between the Standing Stones & the Sea?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When the midnight tide washes in on the beach below your village, there is only a body's length between the old standing stones that rise from the sand and the churning, moonlit surf.

There is a work you must do, and you must do it tonight, and you must do it in a sacred place, and that place must be a boundary.
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: Will You Lie with Me Tonight Between the Standing Stones & the Sea?

boardgame.name: What's So Gay About Robin Hood?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Even among the outlaws, not many knew of you and your beloved, but then while Sherwood’s famous outlaws were on some important quest, your love was taken, and there was only you to save them.

If not rescued, your beloved will be hanged at Nottingham Fair. Will you find them? Will they see you again? Will you escape, even for just a time? Will someone you trust betray you?
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Gay About Robin Hood?

boardgame.name: Smack Talk Showdown: Lewd ADDitude
boardgame.description:
The Lewd ADDitude expansion for Smack Talk Showdown includes 100 new NSFW cards to give your smack talking action that extra edge.

Lewd ADDitude is the NSFW expansion to Smack Talk Showdown. Take your smack talk to the next level, but maybe put the kids to bed first.

It can be played as a standalone game or be combined with the base version of Smack Talk Showdown.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rookery (Dec 2020 - Issue 1)
boardgame.description:
Rookery

December 1, 2020

Classes of Magic

boardgame.name: Rookery (Feb 2021 - Issue 2)
boardgame.description:
Rookery

February 15, 2021

Winter Travels, Woodland Roads

boardgame.name: Monster Capture Race
boardgame.description:
Travel around monster island capturing monsters and powering them up while playing as 1 of the 11 unique characters.
Each character has two special skill cards and a main ability that helps them gain advantages.

Be careful as some characters move in the opposite direction.
Lastly, do not become too powerful, otherwise the dragon will come for you. Not only making you take huge amounts of damage but also destroying all the equipment you have gained!
The game is won through being the first player to collect 15 victory points or by being the last player standing. Players move around the board capturing monsters for victory points equivalent to that monsters power level. Players will also achieve victory points when one of their monsters deals damage to an opposing player that fails to defend themselves also equal to their monsters level.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Grandmaster's Guide to NPCs
boardgame.description:
William Shakespeare wrote "All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages."

These non-players are the common men and women whose actions, words and efforts drive the heroes and
heroines to distraction, motivation or espousing some soliloquy while waxing poetic.

Collected here for the first time is the largest collection of Marvel Superheroes RPG NPCs ever gathered in one book.
boardgame.rpgseries: MA - Marvel Superheroes Advanced Game Accessories

boardgame.name: Necrobiotic Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
From the KickStarter

In a broken world where the dead are machines that do the heavy lifting for us, we are just a cog in the social engine, alive at first and forever once dead. The greatest good is to protect human life, at any cost. Nothing is worth more: not the body's sanctity, nor mental sanity.

In Necrobiotic, you can taste the whole spectrum of emotions, from the deepest horror and the bitterest melancholy to the most moving compassion and the lightest laughter, in a continuous celebration of life and a rediscovery of its fragile uniqueness. The original illustrations will drag you into the alleys of a wounded Florence, among human corpses with tanned leather hides, eternal monuments, and coarse foggy streets.

The original game system is based on deck-building mechanics with a standard deck of playing cards, though Tarot cards can also be used. Players will always know what they can do alone or together, and the game's mechanics will easily push the player’s roleplay toward the character’s features, highlighting everyone's specialties.

Necrobiotic is a dark celebration of life where survival is paramount. It features unique and emotional art along with a new card system that will draw your players into our grim future.

boardgame.name: Travelus: Connect
boardgame.description:
This is one of the eight games built on a flexible and unique modular game design that makes playing numerous games with a set of shared components possible and sold in a boxed set.

As a seasoned traveler, you reap unforgettable experiences around the Continents. While you enjoy visiting places with spring-like weather, islands surrounded by turquoise water, and peaceful oases with the loveliest sunsets, you relish the experiences and connections with the people you meet throughout your journey that enhance your perspective and enrich your world.

To win, all you have to do is to collect a minimum of 3 Passport Stamps and the most Connection cards. You start with 1 Passport Stamp collected and the game ends when someone gets 4. Each Traveler who has at least 3 Passport Stamps then adds up the Connection cards they have. You may not be the one who got the most Passport Stamps, but you could still have made more connections and win!

On your turn, you roll a die and move the number of spaces rolled. When you land on the Passport Office, you can collect that Continent's Passport Stamp, using the Capital and Connection cards collected along the way. Getting connections is as simple as landing on the space, then reading and voting on a statement. You get a connection when the majority agrees with you! You will need money for expenses and to pay for Passport Stamps. Luckily, there are cards that can help you in numerous ways - by moving you across continents in one move, winning a lottery, and even getting free Passport Stamps! But watch out because they also can land you in jail or incur unexpected expenses.

boardgame.name: 1001 mages
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a Mage. You cast spells and look down on muggles. You also complete random quests for fame and glory. The other mages are not your friends, they are your rivals. Do not forget that.

boardgame.name: Visions of Derna: The Raid on Tasimboko – A scenario for Chain of Command
boardgame.description:
This is a one-off scenario based on the US Marine Raiders and Parachutists attack on the Japanese held village of Tasimboko during the Guadalcanal campaign.
Like their predecesors before them near Tripoli, lead Edson's Raiders in seizing critical Japanese supplies or defend the village as the IJA from these pirates!

The scenario is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies' Chain of Command, however it can be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

boardgame.name: Travelus: Excavate
boardgame.description:
Scientists have made an incredible discovery - a giant deposit of a new vital precious metal in the center of Destinarc. One ounce of this material can power a huge city for decades. The discovery is lying close enough to the surface to be mined, but too far down to be found using current exploration methods so it takes a squad of 8 different types of mining and metal experts to work together. To win a contract to mine, you are expected to lead your squad through this expedition and be the first to arrive at the mine.

Your mission is to find the fastest and safest way to get your 8 members from 8 Domains to the mine.

Each member starts their journey alone. On your turn, you roll a die and move one of your members the same number of spaces. You can get closer and quicker by going through tunnels. But wait! Competing squads may be there blocking your way forward. And if they land on you, they can send you back to where you started!

Mercifully, there are power drills that can help you, but getting them is not an easy task. Prospect cards may help but they may also hinder so you are taking a chance each time you pick one up.

This is one of the eight selected games built on a flexible and unique modular game design that makes playing numerous games with a set of shared components possible.

boardgame.name: Cultivator
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A dwarf flexes his fingers as the newest weapon disappears inside his core. Delighted by the prospect of mastering these new arms, he summons the weapon to his hands as he rises to charge his sparring partner. The hammer connects, knocking the opponent back and off balance, only to be instantly assaulted by the blades that replace the hammer in a flash.

While her enemies pour into the room to surround her, the elf calmly prepares her next move with energy crackling between her hands. When the moment is right, she vanishes in a burst of lightning. Her befuddled foes don’t realize that she’s now standing in the entrance behind them until she unleashed waves of electricity back into the chamber.

An orc drops from the roof, rolling with the fall to come back up running. Heading towards his companions, he can see they are blissfully unaware of the sorcerer preparing something devastating behind them. He throws his shield at the sorcerer and connects, buying him more time to arrive behind his party to generate a large shield of light and part the sea of fire that spews forth from the caster.

Cultivators are those who would learn powerful techniques to further their strength. They see every fight as an opportunity to grow, and every enemy is a treasure trove of experience waiting to be plundered. A cultivator often seeks physical perfection in themselves and their techniques.

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars
boardgame.description: Add additional cards to liven up your game and miniatures to spruce up your board.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest

listing.notes: Game weight: 0.100 kg
Title: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Spawn Gates and Gods' Altars Publisher: Ares Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Oerth Journal (Issue 35 - Winter/Spring 2020-21)
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:
"Articles about things found during Growfest, and a wide variety of other topics!
● Scholarly Selection of Suel Secrets - by Michael Bridges
● Wilds of Womtham - by Rodney Hart
● Legends of the Gnarley Forest: Wild Ange - by Les Reno
● Dust Cutters - by William Dvorak
● Outlying Territories of Lo Nakar - by Amy Crittenden
● Fistful of Baubles, pt 2. - by David Leonard
● Omnipotent View - The Kel Avone Retna - by Richard Di Ioia
● Paluserus - Black Dragon of the Gnatmarsh - by Paul Jurdeczka
● The Lezcy - by Nathan Doyle
● Constellations of Greyhawk: Growfest - by Andy Miller
● Clothes Maketh the Man - by Mark Allen
● Fighting Monks - by Phalastar Greycloak"

boardgame.name: Rogue Dungeon: 3p Add-on Pack
boardgame.description: This add-on pack provides components for 2 additional players for the base game as well as additional components.

boardgame.name: Pursuit of Victory
boardgame.description:
Europe, 1805. Emperor Napoleon prepares his La Grande Armée for a perilous invasion of the United Kingdom. Only the might of the Royal Navy stands between him and the British Isles – that and Napoleon’s own meddling in international politics. Austria and Russia, thrust into the welcoming embrace of Britain, mobilize their forces... Will the British forge a Grand Coalition and annihilate Napoleon’s armies in one decisive battle? Or will the Emperor force his enemies to submit after a series of dazzling campaigns?

Pursuit of Victory is a 2-player game of military conquest and diplomatic realignment, of bold action and meticulous planning, playable in a couple of hours. Napoleon will have to face an ever-shifting combination of European powers, consider the fate of Spanish and Polish people, and keep an eye on small, but mobile British forces. Britain will have to contain Napoleon’s ambitions, stoke the fire of Spanish insurrection, subsidize their allies and wait for an opportunity to strike a crucial blow against the French.
In Pursuit of Victory players simultaneously play two cards. One for its initiative value and up to two actions, and the other one for its various military and diplomatic effects. Each player has a hand of 10 cards and playing any given card makes it unavailable for next 2-3 turns. And there are always the two national questions looming ahead. The French can recreate Poland and take over Spain, but will the gains outweigh the costs?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dinogang
boardgame.description: There is little life in the area and every species wants to acquire as much land as possible for itself. Add dinosaurs to create as many gangs as possible and block other species. Toss your opponents with hot lava or vegetable treats to thwart their plans. Get an island just for your DinoGang. At the beginning of the game, we secretly call the dinosaur species to watch out for. During the game we will take turns placing dominoes with similar cards, different dinosaurs as the common play area. We obtain the cards, which we place based on a sketch. The object of the game is to add cards in such a way that we finally sort out the largest group of our students. The rules for adding cards are very similar to classic dominoes. In addition to the dinusia, there are also special fields on the cards that make it easier for us to play or spoil other players ’lines. Whoever creates the biggest dinosaur gang from their charges at the end of the game wins!

boardgame.name: WOODS
boardgame.description:
Everything happened so fast… And even if people could have seen it coming, what could they have actually done? David was one of the ‘lucky’ ones. Far from the chaos, yet he felt the impact all the same. Now, trying to understand everything that happened, he found himself returning to a place that called to him.
A place that offered the best possible chance for his survival… WOODS.

Welcome to WOODS. In the first Part of Woods you have the seemingly easy task of simply keeping a fire going, and protecting yourself from the cold in winter. Chop wood, feed the fire, and survive. A simple task at first, but once Winter wanes, the challenge is increased as David will have to learn to farm, make traps to catch small animals, and eventually learn to hunt to survive. Along the way, learn about Davids story from his past and why he must survive.

In WOODS there are no heroes. Just you, the elements, and the will to survive.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Snowdonia: Time-travelling Police Box
boardgame.description:
A single-card promo of a time-travelling police box "train".

All excavation and building spaces are available to you when you excavate/build (even if they are out of sequence or have not been 'reached' yet).

When you take the Lay Track action, you may lay track on any available track card (empty in most scenarios, full in The Daffodil Line) out of the usual sequence too.

The owner of this train may pay 1 Coal to get their Third Labourer companion out of the Pub.

boardgame.name: Ostium: First Player Coin
boardgame.description: Metal first player coin for Ostium. It can also be used to choose the first player. It was added as a bonus when preordering the game.

boardgame.name: MadBlox
boardgame.description: This game is based around the idea of the wooden blocks game in which players have to take blocks out of the tower without knocking them down. The twist that MadBlox offers is that each block comes with two possible challenges for the player to choose from. Thus, after carefully taking out the block from the tower, the player has to complete one of the two challenges depicted on the piece. If the player refuses to do so, they have to take a shot.

boardgame.name: Shiver Me Timbers: Fifth Player expansion
boardgame.description: Everything that's needed to add a fifth player to the Shiver Me Timbers base game. Includes a modular ship miniature, two player boards and 2 punchboards with markers.

boardgame.name: The 80s: Killing Monsters in the Reagan Economy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Killing Monsters in the Reagan Economy is the eighteenth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the third in our Season Three series of zupplements, each detailing a different decade of the 20th century in the world of #iHunt.

This one details the 1980s, and it's a whopping 75 pages long!

Inside, you'll find:

Pop Up History: A series of current events flashpoints, each with story ideas for how to tie that event or phenomenon into your #iHunt stories.
Hunter Cliques: Four new hunter groups. In the 80s, three of the main core rulebook #iHunter groups exist. But these four new groups embody the themes of the decade and can fight alongside the current batch.
Killing Monsters in the Reagan Economy: A series of tiny essays and ideas for how things work for hunters in the 80s. Without an app, how do hunters keep working? Good question. We answer that and dozens of other questions here.
Eight new monsters, all homages to 80s pop culture. Four new vampires giving an #iHunt twist to Near Dark, Lost Boys, and others. Four other monsters pulled from the zeitgeist, including an official take on the 80s classic sci-fi horror flick Hobgoblins, as popularized by Mystery Science Theater 3000!
Guest author, Star Trek: Discovery screenwriter Carlos Cisco, gives us a "lost television show" for the world of #iHunt. It's a Saturday morning cartoon called The Latchkey Kids, and it's a doozy. Full to the brim with story ideas.

boardgame.name: Lambda-16
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An interstellar communications post on a far-flung world is the focus of odd behavior of animals in the valley around it. A xenobiologist desperate for answers hires the adventurers to get to the bottom of the aberrations. But their investigation might lead them to discovering things they weren’t prepared for, and fighting a foe that doesn’t want them knowing too much.

Lambda-16 is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: Islands in the Sky
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Recently something very unusual has been discovered in the cloudy skies over the water workd Urnadkapus. There are islands floating over the vast ocean. These islands have never been noticed before due to the sparse population of this world and the near constant cloud cover of this world.

Who might have lived on these islands? Are there alien relics there to be found? What power source allows for these islands to float as they do? The patron offers payment for travelers brave enough to visit these islands and find out.

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 21 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

Farsight, Black Void, languages in Chivalry & Sorcery, D&D, Gamesmasterclass, Sentinel Comics RPG, Dark Peaks, Peter F. Hamilton, Kitra, Land of the Rising Sun, Leigh Russell, Crusader Kings III

boardgame.name: Geppetto's Folly
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your respite is interrupted by what appears to be a domestic squabble. After several minutes, one party storms out of Grey Goose Tavern after a stern warning. Moments later the plaza outside becomes the site of a large problem and it is time for you to go back to hero work!

The scenario was designed for a quartet of second level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch.

boardgame.name: Roguish Archetype: The Chronoklept
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time is precious. Everyone tries to save time, spend time, make time. Clearly, “time” is a currency, and if time truly is money, what stops an enterprising individual from investing theirs more wisely? Can one take a loan on their time?

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a rogue character, the Chronoklept gives you options to build a rogue willing to flaunt conventional cause and effect, using psionic power to change recent history to their advantage.

boardgame.name: Flipword
boardgame.description:
Flipword is word game system that fits in your pocket. Each card of the 9-card deck contains 4 conditions for a word or phrase, and is capable of creating over 5,000 combinations of conditions for the base game. Players flip cards from a center pile to the left and right, revealing 3 conditions, then try to be the fastest to think of a word or phrase which fits these conditions. Stumped? Each player can rotate one card once during a game to swap conditions.

The rule book includes 9 more games to play with the Flipword deck, from light party games to 2-player back-and-forth battles to in-hand games and thinky solo challenges.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Treasure Dive
boardgame.description:
In Treasure Dive, players are immersed in deep sea exploration, attempting to collect all of the sunken treasures before their opponents do.

Divers strategically travel around the board to find and recover hidden treasures, but must carefully navigate through murky waters, and keep out a keen eye out for their opponents.

Treasure cards are drawn to indicate where the treasures will appear on the board. Players roll the die and move their pawns along the dotted paths. Upon landing on a hidden treasure, the player flips the piece to reveal a gold coin, diamond, jeweled ring, or silver chalice. It can also feature a boat which sends a diver back to their starting point.

Divers can strategically bump each other back to their boats, by passing through the a spot on a the board that's occupied by an opponent.

Divers may also choose to take the longer more predictable routes by staying on the dotted path, or attempt to pass through murky waters to make a quicker trip. To pass through murky waters, players draw a murky water card which indicates if they successfully pass through or not.

The first player to collect all four treasures and make their way to the center of the board wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: TERRANOVA
boardgame.description:
Hostile Alien lifeform detected...
Proceeding to unfreeze passengers...
Human lifeforms: 7
Please proceed immediately to the escape pods...
System alert: escape bay door locked.
Please insert the activation digits to unlock.

Lead the captain and six survivors of the Terranova ship through hex rooms infested by hostile aliens. Recover the six digits necessary to unlock the door to the escape pods before the invaders finish you off.

HOW TO PLAY
Each turn, the player moves his character through a map made up of hexagons (each one represents a room to explore) and rolls dice to determine what he is going to find, being this, a combat against aliens, encounters with other survivors or unexpected events. The player must manage their oxygen, ammunition and items in order to reach the escape pod safely.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Talisman Adventures Character Creation Supplement
boardgame.description: Here players can find additional options to make their heroes even more unique, plus provide inspiration for building their character backgrounds and memorable histories. These include appearance and minor physical peculiarities, beliefs & superstitions, and mementos from their lives before joining the party for adventure and excitement across the Realm. These are in no manner a required part of crafting a new character, but merely offer possibilities to aid and expand the process. (From Introduction to the supplement)

boardgame.name: Voll der Hammer
boardgame.description:
The players are do-it-yourselfers and renovate three of their rooms (bathroom, kitchen, bedroom) and their garden. You score points for DIY work and spending as little money as possible. The first player to reach the garden shed at the end of the course finishes the game; the player with the most points wins. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and either moves the piece the full distance or moves at least one square and uses part of the points for actions, either working or saving money. To work, you must have bought tools at the hardware store beforehand. Tools can also wear out. You can only work in one room at a time; if you score a room, you get points for it. If you score earlier, you get more points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Stormbreaker Dracken Snake
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“An angry sea of sharpened fangs,
With roiling scales beneath boiling waters,
O’ bringer of widow’s wail and sunken dreams,
How can we claim the seas are ours?”
- Bartholomew Tess, ‘The Stormbreaker’

The Deep Mother’s Fang. Musuvean’s Ire. The Storm Rider. There are many names whispered in dockside taverns through clenched jaws and from under furrowed brows, all describing the same terrible creature that haunts the tales and dreams of sailors the world over. A slew of monikers to call a thing that should not be spoken of, lest its true name bring its wrath.

Unfortunately for these superstitious souls, no matter how they speak of it, the stormbreaker dracken snake is still out there waiting.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on the aquatic terror, the stormbreaker dracken snake!
A Stat block for this CR 17 creature, complete with legendary and lair actions.
Plot hooks to get your party of adventurers involved with this new creature.
A new set of armor that can be crafted from the stormbreaker dracken snake's impressive hide.

boardgame.name: Tricube Tales: Solo Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tricube Tales is a rules-lite roleplaying system capable of handling a wide range of different genres and settings. Its simplicity lends itself well to solo play, and it should work with most generic solo rules, but these guidelines are designed to complement the Tricube Tales one-page settings.

This product can be printed on a single sheet of paper. The first page explains how to answer questions, and offers some general advice for running solo games, while the second page explains how to structure the story, and provides random tables for scenes, locations, people, and events. The PDF uses layers for ease of printing.

Solo and GMless Gaming
Roleplaying games are traditionally played with a Game Master, who runs the adventure and answers the players’ questions. By contrast, these rules are designed for playing without a Game Master, using dice and random tables (usually called “oracle tables” in the solo gaming community) to provide interpretive answers—much like flipping a coin, using a Magic 8-Ball, or rolling Story Cubes.

So why play without a GM? Sometimes it may be difficult to find a group willing to play your favorite game, or prove impossible to schedule a time that suits everyone. Or perhaps you’re in lockdown during the pandemic and have limited internet access, or simply don’t like playing online. You might even have a regular group, but find that nobody wants to be the Game Master, so you’d like some way to play without one.

boardgame.name: Defiant Awakening
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Defiant RPG is an urban fantasy game about the mighty, modern-day supernaturals, who rebelled against their destiny and, instead of destroying the world, decided to protect it. By enforcing a demanding set of rules, the Defiant aristocracy empowers protective seals around their cities, making them the only safe-havens in a world ravaged by the Apocalypse.

The Player Characters are the Defiant blue-bloods, leading the supernatural society of fallen angels, demons, ancient gods, and dragons. They are powerful rulers, with their own Holdings (like clubs or luxurious mansions) and faithful subjects.

Defiant Awakening is a free Defiant Quickstart. It covers all the basic concepts of the game and setting, along with game rules needed to start playing Defiant. This guide should be more than enough to play a couple of mini-Episodes with your friends and get to know the game.

In Defiant Awakening, you will find a short Chronicle, taking place in the Bridgewood Boulevard Province, a few months before the events described in a main Defiant rulebook. You will be able to play as fallen Angels and Daeva, the ancient gods, and choose from several character creation options (no pre-designed characters). Aside from many NPCs and locations described in the book, there are six Threads and many Story Hooks to help the GM run the Chronicle without much effort. And if you get attached to your Characters, you can continue playing them in the main rulebook Chronicle.

boardgame.name: StrongerMan: To the Top
boardgame.description:
Rigatoni’s secret hideout has been discovered at the top of a skyscraper, and since that troublemaker is always cooking up some rotten plan, StrongerMan hopes to catch him before he can escape! Race to the top of the building, avoiding Rigatoni’s goons and traps, and don’t SMASH too much, or the building may collapse!

StrongerMan: To the Top is a superhero solitaire in which players make choices every turn to utilize StrongerMan's unparalleled strength while attempting to control his volatile (and destructive) temper. The player races against the clock to get to the top of a building, all the while keeping the building’s damage in check. While it evokes a very story-driven feel, the game features fairly simple resource management mechanics with a dose of luck (and luck mitigation).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Relative Velocity
boardgame.description: Everything about this assignment felt wrong - right from the very beginning. You should have known this was more than a minor off the books smuggling job on the side of the large shipment of medical scanners. But, the scanners were important and the crew was all too short on credits to keep a roof over their families, and the family fed. Hell, this time each of them can expect to bring back enough to even splurge on organically farmed food instead of the lab protein and supplement kits and buy their homes in the terraformed frontier worlds. Still, they could feel it in their bones when the android watched you lay down for cryo-sleep, that there was going to be trouble.

boardgame.name: Buła, Pizza, Czapka, Prezent, Tort
Süti, sapi, taco, pizza, ajcsi
Taco Chapeau Gâteau Cadeau Pizza
Taco Hat Cake Gift Pizza
타코 햇 케익 기프트 피자
boardgame.description:
Taco Hat Cake Gift Pizza!

As soon as there is a match between a card and a spoken word, race to slap your hand on the central pile of cards. The last one to do so must take them all.

Be quick to be the first to get rid of all your cards. But watch out! Your mind will play

And guess what? There are new powers!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Der Hexcrawl
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This is a general supplement for several/all role playing games that contains ideas and hints for the game master for overland adventures.

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – The Civil War Battles
boardgame.description: The Civil War Battles is the first issue of the 3-part Civil War story arc. A conflict has been brewing between Iron Man and Captain America for their stances on the Superhero Registration Act. As it begins to bubble over it will turn the entire world into a battleground for the world's most powerful superheroes! Friend against friend and brother against brother, which side will you choose?
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel Crossover Vol. 4, Issue 11

listing.notes: Title: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – The Civil War Battles Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – Secret Avengers
boardgame.description: Secret Avengers is the second issue of the Civil War story arc. The Secret Avengers are on the front lines to bolster Captain America's resistance force. Join Cap in assembling a covert and powerful squad of superheroes loyal to the cause to counter the grave threats to superhero liberty!

listing.notes: Title: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – Secret Avengers Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – Thunderbolts
boardgame.description: In this final installment to the Civil War story arc, hero on hero conflict reaches a fevered pitch as Iron Man forges new and questionable alliances with reformed super villains. This unbelievably powerful Thunderbolts team will lead the charge in hunting down and capturing the renegade heroes.

listing.notes: Title: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – Thunderbolts Publisher: Upper Deck Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: SKATE
boardgame.description: All players play at the same time in this fast paced deck building table top game. Collect cards and build a deck that has the best combos. Win letters by having the highest points in your combo. Win all five letters in SKATE to win the game. 2 players per deck. 10-20 minute games (time increases slightly with more players). This is a skateboarding themes game with imagery and lingo appropriate to the theme for an edgy street feel to match.

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Alloy Dice Set
boardgame.description: 20 beautiful metal alloy dice. One set is sufficient for both Victorum and Remastered.

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Victorum – Hero Tracker Mat
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your Hero Tracker Pad with this deluxe mat, featuring a separate box and 12 pegs to save your state between Acts.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Victorum – Premium Chip Bag
boardgame.description:
Level up your chip-drawing experience with our embroidered free-standing chip bag.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hoplomachus: Premium Health
boardgame.description:
Give your gladiators an upgrade with these premium health chips, which replace the lighter health chips found in the Hoplo base games.

A set of 68 Red/Blue Premium Health Chips.

boardgame.name: Mint Control: Swap Promo
Mint Control: Tausch Promokarten
boardgame.description:
The Swap Promo allows you to replace another player's influence token with one of your own and to play the difference if it is a more expensive influence token.

This promo was released as a Kickstarter exclusive for Mint Control's first crowdfunding campaign.

boardgame.name: We Can Play: Women who Changed The World
boardgame.description:
Throughout history, great women have fought for our rights and defied the norms. Women showing us a path to follow. Our hopes are that this game will keep their examples alive in a fun way. Encourage the new generations to dream big. And show that there’s place for all of us.

The game contains 101 illustrated cards, 96 of them are women who have change the world. Five of them are the anonymous cards which you can use strategically and they represent all the anonymous women who also have changed the world.

The aim of the game is to arrange the cards chronologically.
You can choose to go faster at the risk of losing cards.
The winner is the first one to get at least 7 cards in chronological order

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Echo Sector
boardgame.description:
June 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, a new boss, a new set of enemies and a new event.


Released in the June 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: AdvanceQuest: Among I, The Fungi
boardgame.description:
AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

Adventure awaits and a sinister evil grows in the Great Myconid Kingdom, a tangled forest of towering mushrooms. Join forces with a brave mushketeer and fight back to back in... Among I, the Fungi.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!


A solo micro-game designed by C.C. Chamberlin, based on Dungeon Hero. Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then start the adventure.

boardgame.name: Ready 2 Help
boardgame.description:
The game that teaches you how to...
Stay Safe
Stay Calm
Get Help
Give Info
Give Care

Brought to you by FEMA.

This is a small family card game that the winner is the first to collect five emergency cards.

During a turn an emergency card is flipped over and read aloud. Players then take turns playing Skill or Take Action cards from their hand. If the player has enough cards to complete the requirements of the emergency then they collect the card and play passes to the next player. Hand limit of 5 cards.

boardgame.name: Lily's Garden
boardgame.description: Help Lily restore her great-aunt's garden to its former glory and rediscover her roots. Dig into a story full of twists and turns as Lily interacts with a cast of colorful characters.

boardgame.name: Tour of Dice: Vietnam
boardgame.description:
January, 1964: Welcome to the U.S. Military Assistance Command, Vietnam - Special Operations Group (SOG). By volunteering for this duty, we expect great things from you. The North Vietnamese Army and the Viet Cong are making a push towards Saigon. We’ll call their combined forces the VC.

Through covert ops, we need you to throw a wrench into the VC wheels and turn this war around for Democracy. We’ll be focusing in Laos and Cambodia, strictly unofficially.

As the One-Zero (Team Leader), your job is to outfit your crew, get in, get the job done, and get out. You’ll be heavily outnumbered and outgunned, but we believe in you.

Tour of Dice: Vietnam is a card-driven game for 1 player. Built from the ground up to be a great solo experience for the SOG player, Tour of Dice uses a solobot to control the Viet Cong.

As the SOG player, you sign on for 12+ secret missions from dangerous Assassinations, Heart-pounding POW rescues, Hijacking trucks, Infiltrating bases, and much more.

With limited resources, you can call on Chopper Support and Airstrikes in attempts to gain a hold on the battles. Your outnumbered team of special forces need to sneak through the jungle. Each unit of a team equals a single soldier working towards the cause. Heavy bunkers, hidden snipers, and torrential weather all stand in your way.

Will your Tour will be a success or a disaster? Tactics and Luck will decide.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Don't Turn Off The Lights
boardgame.description:
Competitive, fast-paced card game of 2-6 players (Recommend 3-4). Fight monsters and keep your lights on! Fun mechanics and unique art.

Every player must have the required number of lights on to keep monsters from attacking them that round, if not they will take one of your lives. Deflect monsters onto other players by turning off their lights or drawing and playing a card that will have a unique effect on the game.

Win simply by having every other player lose all of their lives.

boardgame.name: CATAN: 3D Edition
Catan: Edición 3D
CATAN: Edycja 3D
卡坦3D
卡坦島 3D版
카탄 3D
boardgame.description:
In CATAN, players try to be the dominant force on the island of Catan by building settlements, cities, and roads. On each turn, dice are rolled to determine what resources — sheep, wheat, wood, brick and ore — the island produces. Players spend these resources to build settlements, roads, and cities and to purchase development cards that have different effects. Each settlement and city you have is worth points, and you can gain additional points by building the longest road, acquiring the largest army, or collecting certain development cards. The first player to collect 10 points wins.

In CATAN: 3D Edition, the island of Catan rises off the table for an immersive experience like no other. Your settlements grow from fertile grain fields, and your cities nestle into the sides of majestic mountains. The look of the land is based on terrain tiles hand-sculpted by game designer Klaus Teuber. All of the terrain is hand-painted for stunning color, and the intricately-designed player pieces are antiqued for a look that's full of history and character.

—description from the publisher

Note that this is the same game as Catan, but a decision has been made to keep the entry separate.

boardgame.name: Tanks: Kasserine Pass Game Mat
boardgame.description: A 36" by 36" high quality printed vinyl mat, perfect for your tanks to engage over in combat. It depicts a desert road bracketed by four escarpments.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Hedkrakka's Madmob
boardgame.description:
All Bonesplitterz carry a spark of the violent god Gorkamorka's wild rage in their cracked minds. In the Wurrgog Prophet Hedkrakka, the self-proclaimed 'Gob of Gork', this connection is especially strong. Hearing the Great Green God's command through his serpent familiar, Hedkrakka led his Madmob far across the realm of Ghur, seeking a beast of truly colossal proportions. In the living mountain, Beastgrave, they found their prey.

While you might not expect it from a warband that takes advice from a talking snake, Hedkrakka's Madmob can do a bit of everything in Warhammer Underworlds. They're tough, they can fight, there's enough of them to easily claim objectives, and they can really take advantage of the Primacy mechanic. This set also features universal cards for any warband in Warhammer Underworlds, while a free downloadable warscroll lets you fight with Hedkrakka's Madmob in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This set contains:

4x push-fit Hedkrakka's Madmob miniatures – no glue required to assemble
4x fighter cards, representing each warrior in your games – Hedkrakka, Toofdagga, Wollop da Skul, and Dakko Sharp-Stikka
A further 62 playable cards (only available in this set) to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm, including:
12x Hedkrakka's Madmob objective cards
10x Hedkrakka's Madmob upgrade cards
10x Hedkrakka's Madmob ploy cards
10x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
10x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband
9x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband
1x Universal gambit spell cards, usable by any wizard

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Silent Menace Deck
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your decks with Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Silent Menace. This is a massive expansion with something to offer every warband, and it allows you even more choices when choosing your gambits, upgrades, and objectives. It could well be the key to your next killer deck.

This set contains 32 universal cards, consisting of:

12x objectives
10x gambits
10x upgrades


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Sigrid/Sigurd Hero Pack
boardgame.description:
2 additional heroes for Ancient Chronicles that can also be played with Immortal Souls.
—user summary
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest
Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Sigrid Thane/Skald
Sword & Sorcery: Hero Pack – Sigurd Thane/Skald

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Minions
boardgame.description:
The Sword & Sorcery – Ancient Chronicles Minions add-on is used to replace the cardboard minion figures included in Ancient Chronicles and in Northwind Tales with 20 high-quality plastic figures, in the same 30 mm scale as the figures representing Heroes and Enemies.

In this box you can find three different kinds of Minion miniatures: 10 Venom, 5 Nest, and 5 Snow Gremlins.

The Nest is a new menace hiding in the darkest recesses of the Underreign. The insidious Nest can generate hordes of Venom against the Heroes: monstrous giant insects, with razor-sharp claws and poisonous jaws. Once they bite their prey, these monsters inject their lethal poison to weaken and potentially kill the helpless creature.

Even the Snow Gremlins are fearsome and dangerous: No matter how harsh the climate is, no matter how many predators there are around, Gremlins always find a way to survive! Snow Gremlins are distant relatives of the Gremlins of the Talon Coast, mutated to adapt to the frigid climate of the Northern Lands. Almost immune to cold thanks to their thick fur, there's only one thing these creatures love more than themselves... gold and shiny objects!

—description from publisher

Contents

10 Venom miniatures
5 Nest miniatures
5 Snow Gremlin miniatures

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Nemeses
boardgame.description:
An expansion set which will challenge Heroes to face an extraordinary opponent: their own dark side. Heroes’ Nemeses are the “evil twins” of the Heroes, embodying their darkest thoughts and fears, the evil recesses of their souls. A Hero's Nemesis is a being of pure evil, with the destruction of the Hero as its only purpose, and skills and powers to match him.
—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Kickstarter Set
boardgame.description:
This exclusive stretch goal box from the Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles Kickstarter includes the hero Mist (Death Guardian or Necrowarrior) and her nemesis form, the nemesis form of Tristan, and the Kickstarter-exclusive Elf Knight on Foot enemy figure.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Treasure Chest

boardgame.name: Dunginoes
boardgame.description:
Explore the dungeon and look for secret passages in this no-print-just play dominoes game.

Themed Dominoes and rules are available on the designer's website.

boardgame.name: Mushoku Tensei Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

After the ancient Dragon God waged a titanic war and the seven original worlds crashed into one another, and after the millennia of racial war that followed, the world you find yourself in resembles much in the way of the aesthetic ideal of a fantasy world. Here you will find sword and sorcery, men and demons, and adventure and intrigue. But under the familiar veneer lays a world that possesses its own unique appeal.

boardgame.name: Groovy Noir - The Weird Detective TTRPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A case no one else may address seeks resolution. Others either do not take it seriously or fail to make sense of the events. You may or may not be a true detective but you know you cannot rest until the case is resolved, no matter how weird the developments around it may become.

boardgame.name: A Darkened City
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Once brilliant Caer Callidyrr has darkened, and the Slain sits on the High King’s throne. Helpless to fight this unknowable enemy, the forces of light have asked you to infiltrate the enemy’s stronghold and learn all you can. Will you dare the shadowed streets of the capital of the Moonshaes to gain entry to the Court of the Slain?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Content Warning. This adventure contains themes of abuse, grief, mental illness, and mind control. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: A Darkened Court
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Court of the Slain at Caer Callidyrr holds many intrigues and even more danger. Yet you must walk these darkened halls and speak in whispers to uncover the malevolent plots of the Slain. Careful, now. One wrong step or a misplaced word could mean exposure and oblivion.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Content Warning. This adventure contains themes of classism, graphic violence, grief, mental illness, and mind control. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: A Darkened Heart
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have worked your way to the heart of the Darkened Court at Caer Callidyrr. There, you have a chance to pierce the shadows and secrets that surround and protect the Slain. Can you reveal the mystery of the greatest threat to the Moonshaes and will you survive to tell anyone else?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

Content Warning. This adventure contains themes of abandonment, abuse, grief, mental illness, and mind control. Player discretion is advised.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #6 - May 2021)
boardgame.description: The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign!

boardgame.name: Wild West Medicine Bag Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The concept of a medicine bag (or bundle) has existed across the world for millennium. The bag is usually a small pouch that hangs off the neck and holds sacred items that the warrior or shaman uses for strength and to protect their soul from danger. It also has a profound cultural significance since each item has a spirit and a story associated with it. While the items of a medicine bag can be bartered among family, the owner must know the item’s story for it to have any power. If the stories of the items in a medicine bag aren’t shared, then the tribe will bury the bag with the warrior when they die. It’s sacrilegious for anyone outside the tribe to even touch it.

This roleplaying tool gives you hundreds of different combinations of medicine bags to add a new dimension to your Wild West game (like Boot Hill, Tall Tales, Dead lands, Wild West, etc.). Each medicine bag should have at least one item from the animal, mineral plant and human tables, or more if the character is more experienced. The other five tables explain the appearance of the bag, the owner’s guardian animal, the current mystic focus of the bag itself, and the source and meaning behind reach of the items. While it’s possible items of worth might be part of the medicine bag, these objects have spiritual power and would never be sold or see the light of day outside of private rituals. Since losing this bag is equal to losing their spiritual power, medicine bags are treated very carefully.

boardgame.name: You are the Dungeon
boardgame.description:
You are the dungeon. You exist on the margins of what they call civilization. You are brooding, tempting, and insatiable. You call to those brave or foolhardy enough to explore your blasphemous depths. They leave with your treasure, yes, but they also leave with a hook buried inside of their souls. They will never forget you, never be free of you, never be clean again.


You are the Dungeon is a single-player journaling and map making game. It needs the contents of the PDF, a deck of tarot cards, and a d10 to play.

They may leave with your treasures and secrets, but they will never vanquish you, never defeat you, never forget you.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Cry Havoc: e-Raptor Insert
boardgame.description:
e-Raptor Insert compatible with Cry Havoc + Aftermath is your must-have accessory designed to organize and improve the experience of the gameplay.

Thanks to our insert you can arrange all game components and sleeved cards to keep them in order – no more mess on the table while playing. No more looking for necessary elements during the game.

Moreover, when the box is closed, the components are still kept in order, ready for setting another game faster than ever!

The insert is durable and made of high-quality HDF. To assemble it, there is no glue required. It allows you to hold all components inside the box.

boardgame.name: Close Call
boardgame.description:
Close Call is a tile drawing, grid-management game for 1-2 players. You play the role of an air traffic controller, guiding aircraft to their destination while avoiding disaster.

Your airspace is represented on the game board by a 13 x 9 rectangular grid. Aircraft of various types, chosen randomly from 72 double-sided tiles, continually enter your airspace, moving according to their pre-determined flight plans. As they travel across the sky in all directions, you can make slight adjustments to their paths. Your ultimate goal is to safely guide them to their destination, but the number of adjustments you can make is limited, and new aircraft enter your airspace every round.

In the Solo Game, you earn points by safely guiding aircraft to their home destinations. Earn enough points and you’ll impress your boss and win the game. Make a wrong decision, though, and the aircraft may be involved in a Close Call, requiring them to be grounded and putting a permanent stain on your performance record. Too many of those and you’ll ultimately get fired—and lose the game.

To add to the challenge, there are also hot air balloon tiles in the bag. Balloons move with the wind, which can change directions each round. You can’t control the balloons—your only recourse is to guide the other aircraft around them. And if that’s not enough of a challenge, you can choose to add a drone, which moves randomly, radar interference zones, which prevent you from making any adjustments, and flight plan changes, which alter the home destination for an aircraft.

In the 2-player variant, you compete with another air traffic controller to determine who’s better at your job. You each control your own fleet of aircraft as well as a neutral set. There are two ways to win: Perform well enough to convince your boss you’re the best, or cause your opponent to look so bad that they get fired.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bombslinger
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A wild west themed game in the style of Bomberman.

boardgame.name: Piraten Duel
boardgame.description: In a journey over land and sea pirates are in a quest for the treasure map. They have to duel other pirates to get it. Every player tries to make smart use of their cards to get to the treasure first.

boardgame.name: Iron Thunder
boardgame.description:
Iron Thunder is a WWII strategy game where you can command tanks, infantry and manage resources to lead your nation to victory!

Key features:

2 or 4 Players
3 Battle Modes (all modes can be played 1v1, 2v2, or 4 player free-for-all)
Choose your battleground by placing your HQ and terrain features
Fight under variable weather conditions (weather affects both military operations and logistics, so you need to react accordingly!)
Command infantry and 4 types of armoured units
Manage resources for calling reinforcements, producing goods and executing advanced manoeuvres
Execute special manoeuvres and tactics by playing cards
Up to 5 different victory conditions, depending on the Battle Mode


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Prendete Fuego
boardgame.description:
On the Internet we are all prettier, more interesting and smarter. Prendete Fuego came to change that.

Prendete Fuego is a party game for people capable of doing anything to win, and for those who want to have fun watching them.


HOW TO PLAY

1) The challenged player turns over an Orange Card and reads it aloud. The Orange Card indicates where you will have to post or to whom you will have to send the challenge.

2) The other players play a Black Card indicating what to send in the message or post.

3) Two of the Black Cards are chosen and if the player dare to complete one of the challenges, they wins as many Little Fires as there are on the card.

The first player to collect 10 Little Fires wins!

boardgame.name: Cassino!
boardgame.description: App version of the traditional fishing card game Cassino/Casino.

boardgame.name: Auf Achse - The Logistics Board Game
boardgame.description:
App version of the board game Auf Achse.

Android: Released.
iOS: Released.

boardgame.name: Amigos de Mierda 2
boardgame.description:
Amigos de Mierda 2 is an independent game that can also be used as an expansion for Amigos de Mierda.

Every group of friends has that one person – the one you’re always joking about (either to their face or not) –, and if you don’t know who that person is, it ought to be you!

Amigos de Mierda (Shitty Friends) is a quick and easy game where players randomly draw cards that make statements or questions about someone’s character. Then, on the count of three, every player on the table points to who they see fit for that situation. The most voted person gets the card, and whoever gets 5 cards first is crowned the Shitty Friend!

Put your colleagues to the test and take your relationships to the limit with Amigos de Mierda (Shitty Friends!)

Includes additional cards for the "RAUNCHY" expansion.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Russia's War: Barbarossa reloaded
boardgame.description:
Russia's War is a new and innovative game on operation Barbarossa in 1941. The game scale is 25km per hexagon and mostly division level for units.
Volume 1 will cover Army group North and Center areas of operations from June 1941 to February 1942.
This game will better simulate the numerous soviet counter offensives which are often forgotten by other titles at this scale. Also, an innovative game system will provide a better feel of the gradual attrition suffered by the Axis and the needed pause of the german mechanised units also rarely simulated before.
A simplified air and naval system combined with the use of Army level off map display for support assets will make the game a very playable "monster".

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Adventure Tin
boardgame.description:
Mint sized solo or cooperative game that you can take with you anywhere. Explore the lands fighting enemies and gaining gold. Visit towns to spend your gold on treasure and crystals. Crystals are consumable items that help you in combat, while Treasure makes your hero stronger for the remainder of the game.

The territory cards and adventure chits make each game unique as you explore the lands trying to find the shadow castle to take down a mini-boss before slaying the final boss: the Dragon.

Adventure and Encounter decks give you choices and keep games feeling fresh with each playthough. Dice rolls can be mitigated with Treasure or the ability to hurt yourself, giving you an interesting risk vs reward mechanic. Dice combat is easy and fast.

There are 4 different classes and each hero has their own strengths. Work together as a team to slay enemies, get stronger, and take on the dragon with teamwork.

Bard - Bonus damage when on a plains location and can buy crystals and treasure for 1 less gold

Knight - Bonus damage when on a mountain location and gets 1 armor resistance

Druid - Bonus damage when on a forest location and is immune to curse status effect

Wizard - Bonus damage when on a shadow location and can reroll one dice each strike phase one time for free

Solo play does not require playing multiple heroes. Game is playable with any single hero.

boardgame.name: Polizze
boardgame.description:
Polizze is a simple promotional game by Raiffeisenbank in which each player moves his piece forward on his own track based on a puzzle result. On the square reached, he uncovers one of 2 cards, which earns either positive, negative or no points at all. If a player reaches the finish line, the player with the most points wins. Though, one tactic could be to send a player who has already collected many minus points to the finish line.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Magic Trolls: End of the Rainbow
boardgame.description: A children's game based on the Magic Troll Babies / Magic Troll Warriors cartoons and toy lines of the early 1990s. In Magic Trolls: End of the Rainbow, players aim to get rid of all of their Magic Troll cards by rolling and moving around the Troll road while playing cards. This family fun & friendly game will help younger Troll enthusiasts practice colors and numbers, but is fun enough for the whole family to enjoy the magic of Trolls.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit Coasters
boardgame.description: These 20 coasters featuring 120 trivial pursuit questions are the perfect addition to any game night. Featuring classic categories, these traditional carded style coasters are the perfect way to choose a starting player, keep trivia night light-hearted, or to spice up any game night.

boardgame.name: Scrabble Coasters
boardgame.description: Spice up game night, or simply show off your love of Scrabble with new coasters. This set contains 26 carded style coasters depicting all the letter tiles on one side, and the classic board spaces on their reverse. Add a little Scrabble flair to your game night, or use them as a quick mini-game to choose starting players or transition between games. The coasters are dealt out evenly between players who must try to make the highest scoring word they can using either side of their coasters. Don't have any vowels? No worries, simply use your coasters to give the edge to one of your friends.

boardgame.name: Postcard Bulge: Ardennes 1944
boardgame.description:
VERY fast and simple hex-and-counter postcard size/format boardgame about the December 1944 German Ardennes counteroffensive, using my previous, popular little Ardennes Petite map which I discovered fits *perfectly* on a postcard. 5 2-day turns. Plays in 30? minutes.

As for Postcard Barbarossa 24 units/pieces. 10 German and 14 American. (There just wasn't space on the card for the British who were basically backup anyway.)

A VERY simplified combat odds calculation system with an 50% chance of survival for any otherwise doomed unit, including even 14th Cavalry Group which was supposed to hold the Losheim Gap (obvious) offensive gateway, and which was stretched thin there, at that.

Includes the push-your-luck 50% Pressed Attack/Desperate Defense combat option which can shift the odds one level for ... or against ... you.

As in Postcard Barbarossa! and most of my other games, the Recovery from Disruption phase arises at different points for different unit types which can be critical.

"Those damned Engineers!" blowing bridges can bring an early German breakthrough to an unforeseen halt, though.

A Chinese translation to be worked up.

NOTE: As long as you keep (only) my copyright statement, its Dedication, and my war&history quotes on it, you are - ANYone is - free to print off copies of my English language edition in postcard - 4"x6"/A6 or 5"x8"/A5 - format to send to family and friends or whomever.

Of course, for your own personal copy, you will want to photocopy-enlarge its pieces and especially its mapboard.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
